title: Solving a Misunderstanding
description: Listen to two friends resolving a conflict.

audio.text:
Jane: Hi Mark. Do you have a minute? I need to talk to you about something.
Mark: Sure, what's up?
Jane: Well, I heard that you told Sarah that I was talking about her behind her back. Is that true?
Mark: What? No, I didn't say that exactly. I think there's been a misunderstanding.
Jane: Then what did you say? Because Sarah told me that you said I was gossiping about her.
Mark: Let me explain. Sarah asked me if you had mentioned anything about her job situation. I just said that you told me she was thinking about quitting. I didn't mean it in a bad way.
Jane: Oh, I see. But you know I told you that in confidence. I trusted you not to share it with anyone.
Mark: I know, and I'm really sorry. I didn't think it would cause any problems. Sarah seemed worried about her future, and I thought she already knew that you knew.
Jane: I understand, but in the future, could you please check with me first before sharing anything I tell you?
Mark: You're absolutely right. I apologize for not being more careful. I should have asked you first.
Jane: I appreciate that. I know you didn't mean any harm.
Mark: I really didn't. I value our friendship, and I don't want something like this to come between us.
Jane: Neither do I. Let's just make sure we communicate better from now on.
Mark: Agreed. And I'll talk to Sarah and explain everything. I don't want her to misunderstand the situation either.
Jane: That would be great. Thanks for being understanding, Mark.
Mark: Of course. And thanks for coming to me directly instead of assuming the worst. I appreciate that.
